comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9,9 +9,19 @@ return {
     -- files. (A nil root_dir and no single_file_support results in the LSP not
     -- attaching.) For details, see #3558
     root_dir = function(filename)
-      return filename:find('/%.(github|forgejo|gitea)/workflows/.+%.ya?ml')
-          and util.root_pattern('.github', '.forgejo', '.gitea')(filename)
-        or nil
+      local patterns = {
+        { pattern = '/%.github/workflows/.+%.ya?ml', root = '.github' },
+        { pattern = '/%.forgejo/workflows/.+%.ya?ml', root = '.forgejo' },
+        { pattern = '/%.gitea/workflows/.+%.ya?ml', root = '.gitea' },
+      }
+
+      for _, entry in ipairs(patterns) do
+        if filename:find(entry.pattern) then
+          return util.root_pattern(entry.root)(filename)

comment_data.body:
I'm away for 1-2 hours.
I waited for my commit till 3576 is merged.

@glepnir 
Is this okay ?

```diff
diff --git a/lua/lspconfig/configs/gh_actions_ls.lua b/lua/lspconfig/configs/gh_actions_ls.lua
index 398c0500..9ea39b85 100644
--- a/lua/lspconfig/configs/gh_actions_ls.lua
+++ b/lua/lspconfig/configs/gh_actions_ls.lua
@@ -1,5 +1,3 @@
-local util = require 'lspconfig.util'
-
 return {
   default_config = {
     cmd = { 'gh-actions-language-server', '--stdio' },
@@ -17,7 +15,10 @@ return {
 
       for _, entry in ipairs(patterns) do
         if filename:find(entry.pattern) then
-          return util.root_pattern(entry.root)(filename)
+          local match = vim.fs.find(entry.root, { path = filename, upward = true })[1]
+          if match then
+            return match
+          end
         end
       end
```

comment_data.body:
Like this ?

```diff
diff --git a/lua/lspconfig/configs/gh_actions_ls.lua b/lua/lspconfig/configs/gh_actions_ls.lua
index 9ea39b85..ebd48f60 100644
--- a/lua/lspconfig/configs/gh_actions_ls.lua
+++ b/lua/lspconfig/configs/gh_actions_ls.lua
@@ -15,7 +15,8 @@ return {
 
       for _, entry in ipairs(patterns) do
         if filename:find(entry.pattern) then
-          local match = vim.fs.find(entry.root, { path = filename, upward = true })[1]
+          local dir = vim.fs.dirname(filename)
+          local match = vim.fs.find(entry.root, { path = dir, upward = true })[1]
           if match then
             return match
           end
````
What do you want me to replace ?

EDIT:
Or dont you like any `filename:` ?
I could o something like this

```lua
      local dirs_to_check = {
        '.github/workflows',
        '.forgejo/workflows',
        '.gitea/workflows',
      }
      local dir = vim.fs.dirname(filename)
      for _, subdir in ipairs(dirs_to_check) do
        local match = vim.fs.find(subdir, { path = dir, upward = true })[1]
        if match and vim.fn.isdirectory(match) == 1 and vim.fs.dirname(filename) == match then
            return match
        end
      end
```

comment_regular_data.body: What exactly is the regression? When I test out gh_actions on master it seems to work for me.

> What exactly is the regression? When I test out gh_actions on master it seems to work for me.

oh really ? 
In my case it doesnt load at all.

this branch:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/666275c9-a0ec-4c52-9e57-bd06bbd5ffcc)

master:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/086dff42-d8e9-4681-bd52-458f80950a01)

Maybe due t nvim 0.11 or something like that I dont know.
This solution at least works accross all devices and combinations I tested
What repo/file are you testing? I'd like to test it.

> What repo/file are you testing? I'd like to test it.

Take that one for instance

https://github.com/Crashdummyy/roslynLanguageServer.git

I cant open `nvim .github/workflows/cleanup.yml`
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4bd6cd66-79cc-486c-9355-a199c92c88fc)

with this change
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/37a4f68c-b261-4117-a457-4a2dfc9097fa)
OK, you're right, I can recreate the problem. Thanks. Let me take a look at the code.

Does the following work? I tried it and autocompletion worked for me

```lua
 root_dir = require('lspconfig.util').root_pattern('.github/workflows', '.forgejo/workflows', '.gitea/workflows'),
```

> Does the following work? I tried it and autocompletion worked for me
> 
> ```lua
>  root_dir = require('lspconfig.util').root_pattern('.github/workflows', '.forgejo/workflows', '.gitea/workflows'),
> ```

Tested that one as well.
First of all I thought I should not use `root_pattern` anymore.
Besides it only detects the existence of `.github/workflows`.

When I open any other random file it tries to attach as well.

EDIT:

```bash
# should be detected
.
├──.github
│    └── workflows
│     ├── CreateSnapshot.yml
│     ├── dotnet.yml
│     ├── loadtests.yml
│     ├── release.yml
│     ├── RestoreSnapshot.yml
│     └── tenantconfigs
│     └── action.yml
│
├── cmiLoadTestSchema.yml # should not be detected

```

> First of all I thought I should not use root_pattern anymore.

Yes, but then I said in https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/pull/3573#discussion_r1924349023 that because of reasons we can still use root_pattern. The current approach of vim.fs.dirname(... is also fine.

> > First of all I thought I should not use root_pattern anymore.
> 
> Yes, but then I said in [#3573 (comment)](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/pull/3573#discussion_r1924349023) that because of reasons we can still use root_pattern. The current approach of vim.fs.dirname(... is also fine.

Oh sorry I misread that.
It felt more like I am still allowed to use it but should prefer to avoid it.
